title: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 with Update 3 - Ult_Prem_Pro
description:
Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 with Update 3 ISO files

These are the MicroSoft iso files for VS2013 with Update 3
When you install using this ISO's setup, it will update any VS2013
install to Update 3. If you don't have VS2013 installed, it will
install that and apply update 3.

I don't follow the VS2013 stuff very closely as I don't do much
programming, but here's a partial list of improvements they claim
to have made in Update 3:

CodeLens
Code Map
Debugger
Performance and Diagnostics
IntelliTrace
Windows Store Apps
Visual Studio IDE
Testing
Bug Fixes & Known Issues
Release Management
Web Tools
Azure Tools
C++
Graphics Diagnostics
Application Insights
ClickOnce Deployment
SharePoint Apps

There are too many modifications to list the details here, but here's
a shortcut to the vs website: <a href="
http://www.visualstudio.com/news/2014-aug-4-vs" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.visualstudio.com/news/2014-aug-4-vs</a>

There's also a KB article about VS2013 updates: <a href="
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2933779" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2933779</a>

Note: You DO NOT need to download this if you prefer direct links.
This download will save you some bandwidth as I've LZMA compressed the
ult file and added 2 small delta patches to prem and pro, but if you just
want to do a single download here are the direct MS links:

You will need these keys to offline-activate the software though:
Ultimate: BWG7X-J98B3-W34RT-33B3R-JVYW9
Premium: FBJVC-3CMTX-D8DVP-RTQCT-92494
Professional: XDM3T-W3T3V-MGJWK-8BFVD-GVPKY

My release file: Visual_Studio_2013_with_Update_3-Ult_Prem_Pro.7z
Size: 4.78 GB
SHA1: B5EDA7982BCD61EC5D2E48F68764B0E46C1E4765
Format: LZMA1, non-passworded

Here's simple instructions:
1 - Extract Visual_Studio_2013_with_Update_3-Ult_Prem_Pro.7z
2 - Double-Click either the prem or pro sfx exe files if you wish
3 - Mount or burn to dual-layer dvd or blu-ray
4 - Install using the setup program
5 - Find the appropriate register/change-key link in the Help tab while inside VS2013
6 - Enter the appropriate key

Note: THERE IS NO x64 VERSION OF VS2013.
The x86 version can compile x64 versions.

If you cannot find the register link, you probably shouldn't be using this.
Programming is not for people without intuition.

Good luck coders,
murphy78 TPB/MDL
